[[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

{{Infobox Officeholder |name =Abdulla Shahid |image = |order = |office =[[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the 17th People’s Majlis]] |president =[[Mohamed Nasheed]], [[Mohamed Waheed Hassan Manik]] |term_start =29 May 2009 |term_end = |predecessor =[[Mohamed Shihab]] |successor = |office2 =[[People’s Majlis|Member of Parliament]] - Keyodhoo Constituency |deputy2 = |term_start2 =9 May 2009 |term_end2 = |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |office3 =Minister of Foreign Affairs |deputy3 = |term_start3 =23 August 2007 |term_end3 =11 November 2008 |predecessor3 = |successor3 = |office4 =President’s Member to the Special Majlis |term_start4 = |term_end4 = |predecessor4 = |successor4 = |office5 =President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] |term_start5 = |term_end5 = |preceded5 = |succeeded5 = |office6 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis |term_start6 = |term_end6 = |preceded6 = |succeeded6 = |office7 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] |term_start7 = |term_end7 = |preceded7 = |succeeded7 = |birth_name = |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |nationality =[[Maldivian]] |party =[[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party|DRP]] |spouse = |children = 2 sons & a daughter |residence =H.Rabee’ee Manzil, [[Malé]] |alma_mater =Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: އަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު) is the current speaker of the [[People’s Majlis]], parliament of the [[Maldives]]. [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

{{Infobox Officeholder |name =Abdulla Shahid |image = |order = |office =[[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the 17th People’s Majlis]] |president =[[Mohamed Nasheed]], [[Mohamed Waheed Hassan Manik]] |term_start =29 May 2009 |term_end = |predecessor =[[Mohamed Shihab]] |successor = |office2 =[[People’s Majlis|Member of Parliament]] - Keyodhoo Constituency |deputy2 = |term_start2 =9 May 2009 |term_end2 = |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |office3 =Minister of Foreign Affairs |deputy3 = |term_start3 =23 August 2007 |term_end3 =11 November 2008 |predecessor3 = |successor3 = |office4 =President’s Member to the Special Majlis |term_start4 = |term_end4 = |predecessor4 = |successor4 = |office5 =President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] |term_start5 = |term_end5 = |preceded5 = |succeeded5 = |office6 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis |term_start6 = |term_end6 = |preceded6 = |succeeded6 = |office7 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] |term_start7 = |term_end7 = |preceded7 = |succeeded7 = |birth_name = |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |nationality =[[Maldivian]] |party =[[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party|DRP]] |spouse = |children = 2 sons & a daughter |residence =H.Rabee’ee Manzil, [[Malé]] |alma_mater =Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: އަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު) is the current and 17th [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]].<ref>http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/</ref> He was elected to the position of the [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28th May 2009 after winning 42 votes out of 75 votes and has been [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] since 29th May 2009<ref>http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459</ref> Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party|DRP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].<ref>|http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37</ref>
Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008<ref>http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/</ref> in the presidency of then [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Earlier he was appointed as Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.
Abdulla Shahid has been serving the Maldivian legislature since 1993 and has been a Member of Parliament since 1995.<ref>http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid</ref>

{{Infobox Officeholder |name =Abdulla Shahid |image = |order = |office =[[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the 17th People’s Majlis]] |president =[[Mohamed Nasheed]], [[Mohamed Waheed Hassan Manik]] |term_start =29 May 2009 |term_end = |predecessor =[[Mohamed Shihab]] |successor = |office2 =[[People’s Majlis|Member of Parliament]] - Keyodhoo Constituency |deputy2 = |term_start2 =9 May 2009 |term_end2 = |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |office3 =Minister of Foreign Affairs |deputy3 = |term_start3 =23 August 2007 |term_end3 =11 November 2008 |predecessor3 = |successor3 = |office4 =President’s Member to the Special Majlis |term_start4 = |term_end4 = |predecessor4 = |successor4 = |office5 =President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] |term_start5 = |term_end5 = |preceded5 = |succeeded5 = |office6 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis |term_start6 = |term_end6 = |preceded6 = |succeeded6 = |office7 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] |term_start7 = |term_end7 = |preceded7 = |succeeded7 = |birth_name = |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |nationality =[[Maldivian]] |party =[[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party|DRP]] |spouse = |children = 2 sons & a daughter |residence =H.Rabee’ee Manzil, [[Malé]] |alma_mater =Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: އަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު) is the current and 17th [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]].<ref>http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/</ref> He was elected to the position of the [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28th May 2009 after winning 42 votes out of 75 votes and has been [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] since 29th May 2009<ref>http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459</ref> Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party|DRP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].<ref>|http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37</ref>
Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008<ref>http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/</ref> in the presidency of then [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Earlier he was appointed as Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.
Abdulla Shahid has been serving the Maldivian legislature since 1993 and has been a Member of Parliament continuously since 1995.<ref>http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid</ref>

[[Maldives]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}}</ref> Rayyithunge Party|DRP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37 | title=J02 - Keyodhoo Constituency | accessdate=September 28, 2012}}</ref>
Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}}</ref> in the presidency of then [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Earlier he was appointed as Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.
Abdulla Shahid has been serving the Maldivian legislature since 1993 and has been a Member of Parliament continuously since 1995.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}}</ref>

{{Infobox Officeholder |name =Abdulla Shahid |image = |order = |office =[[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the 17th People’s Majlis]] |president =[[Mohamed Nasheed]], [[Mohamed Waheed Hassan Manik]] |term_start =29 May 2009 |term_end = |predecessor =[[Mohamed Shihab]] |successor = |office2 =Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency |deputy2 = |term_start2 =9 May 2009 |term_end2 = |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |office3 =Minister of Foreign Affairs |deputy3 = |term_start3 =23 August 2007 |term_end3 =11 November 2008 |predecessor3 = |successor3 = |office4 =President’s Member to the Special Majlis |term_start4 = |term_end4 = |predecessor4 = |successor4 = |office5 =President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] |term_start5 = |term_end5 = |preceded5 = |succeeded5 = |office6 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis |term_start6 = |term_end6 = |preceded6 = |succeeded6 = |office7 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] |term_start7 = |term_end7 = |preceded7 = |succeeded7 = |birth_name = |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |nationality =[[Maldivians|Maldivian]] |party =[[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=2013-04-18}}{{cite news | url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 | title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch | work=Haveeru Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=2013-04-18}} |spouse = |children = 1 Daughter and 2 Sons. |residence = |alma_mater =Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current and 17th [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]].{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He was elected to the position of the [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28th May 2009 after winning 42 votes out of 75 votes and has been [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] since 29th May 2009 {{cite news | url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 | title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker | work=Haveeru Daily | date=May 30, 2009 | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | location=Maldives}} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].{{cite web | url=http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37 | title=J02 - Keyodhoo Constituency | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | language=Dhivehi }} Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} in the presidency of then [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Earlier he was appointed as Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 18 April 2013, Shahid announced on his Twitter that he has signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=2013-01-09}} Earlier on 15th April, he resigned from [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. Abdulla Shahid has been serving the Maldivian legislature since 1993 and has been a Member of Parliament continuously since 1995.{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{Maldives-politician-stub}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Members of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current and 17th [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]].{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He was elected to the position of the [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28th May 2009 after winning 42 votes out of 75 votes and has been [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] since 29th May 2009. He is known and respected as a resolute advocate of human rights and for his commitment to democratic governance. Mr. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. This ability to manage critical political issues is the result of many years of public and political service to the Maldives. {{cite news | url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 | title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker | work=Haveeru Daily | date=May 30, 2009 | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | location=Maldives}} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].{{cite web | url=http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37 | title=J02 - Keyodhoo Constituency | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | language=Dhivehi }} Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} in the presidency of then [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Earlier he was appointed as Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 18 April 2013, Shahid announced on his Twitter that he has signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} Earlier on 15th April, he resigned from [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. Abdulla Shahid has been serving the Maldivian legislature since 1993 and has been a Member of Parliament continuously since 1995.{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{Maldives-politician-stub}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Members of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current and 17th [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]].{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He was elected to the position of the [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28th May 2009 after winning 42 votes out of 75 votes and has been [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] since 29th May 2009. He is known and respected as a resolute advocate of human rights and for his commitment to democratic governance. Mr. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. This ability to manage critical political issues is the result of many years of public and political service to the Maldives. {{cite news | url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 | title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker | work=Haveeru Daily | date=May 30, 2009 | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | location=Maldives}} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].{{cite web | url=http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37 | title=J02 - Keyodhoo Constituency | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | language=Dhivehi }} Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} in the presidency of then [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Earlier he was appointed as Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 18 April 2013, Shahid announced on his Twitter that he has signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} Earlier on 15th April, he resigned from [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. Abdulla Shahid has been serving the Maldivian legislature since 1993 and has been a Member of Parliament continuously since 1995.He is known and respected as a resolute advocate of human rights and for his commitment to democratic governance. Mr. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. This ability to manage critical political issues is the result of many years of public and political service to the Maldives. {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{Maldives-politician-stub}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Members of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

Abdulla Shahid has been serving the Maldivian legislature since 1993 and has been a Member of Parliament continuously since 1995.He is known and respected as a resolute advocate of human rights and for his commitment to democratic governance. Mr. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. This ability to manage critical political issues is the result of many years of public and political service to the Maldives. {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{Maldives-politician-stub}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Members of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current and 17th [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]].{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He was elected to the position of the [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28th May 2009 after winning 42 votes out of 75 votes and has been [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] since 29th May 2009. He is known and respected as a resolute advocate of human rights and for his commitment to democratic governance. Mr. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. This ability to manage critical political issues is the result of many years of public and political service to the Maldives. {{cite news | url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 | title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker | work=Haveeru Daily | date=May 30, 2009 | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | location=Maldives}} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].{{cite web | url=http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37 | title=J02 - Keyodhoo Constituency | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | language=Dhivehi }} Prior to his role as an MP, H.E Abdulla Shahid began serving in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs starting in 1984. His ability was soon recognised and he rose through the ranks quickly to the post of Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at numerous meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. H.E Abdulla Shahid has been serving the Maldivian legislature since 1993 and has been a Member of Parliament continuously since 1995. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. H.E. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the current Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, the H.E Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. H.E Shahid’s service as a Member of Parliament has always been marked by his diligence and active participation in parliamentary debates. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} in the presidency of then [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Earlier he was appointed as Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 18 April 2013, Shahid announced on his Twitter that he has signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} Earlier on 15th April, he resigned from [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{Maldives-politician-stub}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Members of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the current Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, the H.E Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. H.E Shahid’s service as a Member of Parliament has always been marked by his diligence and active participation in parliamentary debates. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of then [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Earlier he was appointed as Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 18 April 2013, Shahid announced on his Twitter that he has signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} Earlier on 15 April, he resigned from [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Members of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

{{Infobox Officeholder |name =Abdulla Shahid |image = |order = |office =[[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the 17th People’s Majlis]] |president =[[Abdulla Shahid]], [[Mohamed Nasheed]], [[Mohamed Waheed Hassan Manik]] |term_start =29 May 2009 |term_end = |predecessor =[[Mohamed Shihab]] |successor = |office2 =Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency |deputy2 = |term_start2 =9 May 2009 |term_end2 = |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |office3 =Minister of Foreign Affairs |deputy3 = |term_start3 =23 August 2007 |term_end3 =11 November 2008 |predecessor3 = |successor3 = |office4 =President’s Member to the Special Majlis |term_start4 = |term_end4 = |predecessor4 = |successor4 = |office5 =President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] |term_start5 = |term_end5 = |preceded5 = |succeeded5 = |office6 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis |term_start6 = |term_end6 = |preceded6 = |succeeded6 = |office7 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] |term_start7 = |term_end7 = |preceded7 = |succeeded7 = |birth_name = |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |nationality =[[Maldivians|Maldivian]] |party =[[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news | url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 | title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch | work=Haveeru Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}} |spouse = |children = 1 Daughter and 2 sons . |residence = |alma_mater =Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current (Interim) President of the Maldives and [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]].{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He was elected to the position of the [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009 after winning 42 votes out of 75 votes and has been [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] since 29 May 2009. He is known and respected as a resolute advocate of human rights and for his commitment to democratic governance. Mr. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. This ability to manage critical political issues is the result of many years of public and political service to the Maldives. {{cite news | url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 | title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker | work=Haveeru Daily | date=May 30, 2009 | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | location=Maldives}} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].{{cite web | url=http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37 | title=J02 - Keyodhoo Constituency | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | language=Dhivehi }} Prior to his role as an MP, H.E Abdulla Shahid began serving in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs starting in 1984. His ability was soon recognised and he rose through the ranks quickly to the post of Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at numerous meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. H.E Abdulla Shahid has been serving the Maldivian legislature since 1993 and has been a Member of Parliament continuously since 1995. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. H.E. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the current Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, the H.E Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. H.E Shahid’s service as a Member of Parliament has always been marked by his diligence and active participation in parliamentary debates. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of then [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Earlier he was appointed as Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 18 April 2013, Shahid announced on his Twitter that he has signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} Earlier on 15 April, he resigned from [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Members of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

revision.comment: Somebody falsely edited the page saying Abdulla Shahid is the president of the Maldives, and without any reference to back the claim. I corrected the false information.

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]].{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He was elected to the position of the [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009 after winning 42 votes out of 75 votes and has been [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] since 29 May 2009. He is known and respected as a resolute advocate of human rights and for his commitment to democratic governance. Mr. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. This ability to manage critical political issues is the result of many years of public and political service to the Maldives. {{cite news | url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 | title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker | work=Haveeru Daily | date=May 30, 2009 | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | location=Maldives}} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].{{cite web | url=http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37 | title=J02 - Keyodhoo Constituency | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | language=Dhivehi }} Prior to his role as an MP, H.E Abdulla Shahid began serving in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs starting in 1984. His ability was soon recognised and he rose through the ranks quickly to the post of Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at numerous meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. H.E Abdulla Shahid has been serving the Maldivian legislature since 1993 and has been a Member of Parliament continuously since 1995. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. H.E. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the current Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, the H.E Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. H.E Shahid’s service as a Member of Parliament has always been marked by his diligence and active participation in parliamentary debates. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of then [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Earlier he was appointed as Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 18 April 2013, Shahid announced on his Twitter that he has signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} Earlier on 15 April, he resigned from [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Dhefuh Keheri Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Members of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} Shahid earned a bachelor’s degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master’s degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Members of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) was elected [[People’s_Majlis#The_Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news | url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 | title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker | work=Haveeru Daily | date=May 30, 2009 | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | location=Maldives}} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].{{cite web | url=http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37 | title=J02 - Keyodhoo Constituency | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | language=Dhivehi }} Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. Abdulla Shahid started serving the Maldivian legislature in 1993, and he became a Member of Parliament in 1995. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} Shahid holds a bachelor’s degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master’s degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Members of the Majlis of the Maldives]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} Shahid holds a bachelor’s degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master’s degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox Officeholder |name =Abdulla Shahid |image = |order = |office =[[People’s Majlis#The Speaker|Speaker of the 17th People’s Majlis]] |president =[[Mohamed Nasheed]], [[Mohamed Waheed Hassan Manik]], [[Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom]] |term_start =29 May 2009 |term_end =2013 |predecessor =[[Mohamed Shihab]] |successor =Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed |office2 =Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency |deputy2 = |term_start2 =9 May 2009 |term_end2 = |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |office3 =Minister of Foreign Affairs |deputy3 = |term_start3 =23 August 2007 |term_end3 =11 November 2008 |predecessor3 = |successor3 = |office4 =President’s Member to the Special Majlis |term_start4 = |term_end4 = |predecessor4 = |successor4 = |office5 =President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] |term_start5 = |term_end5 = |preceded5 = |succeeded5 = |office6 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis |term_start6 = |term_end6 = |preceded6 = |succeeded6 = |office7 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] |term_start7 = |term_end7 = |preceded7 = |succeeded7 = |birth_name = |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |nationality =[[Maldivians|Maldivian]] |party =[[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news | url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 | title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch | work=Haveeru Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}} |spouse = |children = 1 Daughter and 2 sons . |residence = |alma_mater =Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) was elected [[People’s Majlis#The Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news | url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 | title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker | work=Haveeru Daily | date=May 30, 2009 | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | location=Maldives}} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].{{cite web | url=http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37 | title=J02 - Keyodhoo Constituency | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | language=Divehi}} Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. Abdulla Shahid started serving the Maldivian legislature in 1993, and he became a Member of Parliament in 1995. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Shahid, Abdulla | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Shahid | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Maldives politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Male', Maldives | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

{{Infobox Officeholder |name =Abdulla Shahid |image = |order = |office =[[People’s Majlis#The Speaker|Speaker of the 17th People’s Majlis]] |president =[[Mohamed Nasheed]], [[Mohamed Waheed Hassan Manik]], [[Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom]] |term_start =29 May 2009 |term_end =2013 |predecessor =[[Mohamed Shihab]] |successor =Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed |office2 =Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency |deputy2 = |term_start2 =9 May 2009 |term_end2 = |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |office3 =Minister of Foreign Affairs |deputy3 = |term_start3 =23 August 2007 |term_end3 =11 November 2008 |predecessor3 = |successor3 = |office4 =President’s Member to the Special Majlis |term_start4 = |term_end4 = |predecessor4 = |successor4 = |office5 =President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] |term_start5 = |term_end5 = |preceded5 = |succeeded5 = |office6 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis |term_start6 = |term_end6 = |preceded6 = |succeeded6 = |office7 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] |term_start7 = |term_end7 = |preceded7 = |succeeded7 = |birth_name = |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |nationality =[[Maldivians|Maldivian]] |party =[[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news | url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 | title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch | work=Haveeru Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}} |spouse = |children = 1 Daughter and 2 sons . |residence = |alma_mater =Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) was elected [[People’s Majlis#The Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news | url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 | title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker | work=Haveeru Daily | date=May 30, 2009 | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | location=Maldives}} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo constituency]] after getting 43.26% of the votes held on [[Maldivian parliamentary election, 2009|2009]].{{cite web | url=http://www.maldivesmajlis.com/v2_dhaairaa.php?did=37 | title=J02 - Keyodhoo Constituency | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | language=Divehi}} Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. Abdulla Shahid was one among the chosen people of Dictator Maumoon Abdul Gayoom to help create an image of the Maldives as a democratic nation soon after the 1990 discontent and calls for reform and Democracy. Shahid was transferred to the President's Office for the task and spent a large part of his career as Executive Secretary to the Dictator Gayoom before a short stint as Foreign Minister. Abdulla Shahid started serving the Maldivian legislature in 1993 on appointment by Dictator Maumoon Abdul Gayoom, and he became a Member of Parliament in 1995. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. With public discontent growing against Dictator Gayoom's controlling system and brutal action to quell political opposition, Gayoom had no choice but to give in, his carefully cultivated image had to be protected and preserved. To address this ëmergency situation" Gayoom set up his trademark Task Force with the highly learned, polished and charming assigned to create a fictitious democracy. Shahid was the perfect candidate for the Democracy Task Force, a Task Force for every calamity being Gayoom's modus operandi. As a Member of the JSC, and the Speaker of Parliament Shahid successfully killed the Maldives Constitution in a secret and deceptive move that could not be seen by those unfamiliar with the rules and procedures of Constitutional democracy. Shahid got away preventing an Inquiry using his social status and standing and abusing power of both offices of Speaker and JSC Member to effectively kill opportunity for Democracy through rendering the Constitution meaningless. After executing the highly sophisticated and clever Coup Against Constitution (August 2010), Shahid executed a political coup on 7 February 2012 to remove Mohamed Nasheed. He then shifted to MDP and to carry on cover-up and ensure MDP is kept ignorant of his crimes. The devious tactic worked to divert attention away from the core crimes in Maldives Democratic Transition - and to play emotionally with MDP supporters who are unable to see the big picture. Shahid will be remembered for his clever "prank"upon the People of Maldives - the [http://www.dhivehisitee.com/parliament/velezinees-insider-account-jsc-hijacked-judicial-independence/ Silent Coup Against Democracy] (August 2010); a highly sophisticated attack on the Maldives Democracy using the Maldives Judicial Service Commission as dagger and the Parliament as shield. == References == {{Reflist}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |religion =[[Islam]] |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) was elected [[People’s Majlis#The Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 Election.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01}} He was Elected as the [[People’s Majlis#The Speaker|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]], of the [[Maldives]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01}} He served as the [[People’s Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{dv icon}}{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis}} He was elected as the [[People’s Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01}} He served as the [[People’s Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{dv icon}}{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis}} He was elected as the [[People’s Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | dead-url=yes | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

{{Infobox Officeholder |name = Abdulla Shahid
އަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު |image = |order = |office = Minister of Foreign Affairs |president = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] |term_start = 17 November 2018 |term_end = |predecessor = [[Mohamed Asim]] |successor = |president1 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] |term_start1 = 23 August 2007 |term_end1 = 11 November 2008 |predecessor1 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] |successor1 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] |office2 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv}} |president2 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] |term_start2 = 28 May 2008 |term_end2 = 28 May 2014 |predecessor2 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] |successor2 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] |office3 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency |deputy3 = |term_start3 = 28 May 2014 |term_end3 = 14 November 2018 |predecessor3 = |successor3 = |office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency |term_start4 = 28 May 2008 |term_end4 = 28 May 2014 |predecessor4 = |successor4 = |office5 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis |term_start5 = |term_end5 = |predecessor5 = |successor5 = |office6 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] |term_start6 = |term_end6 = |preceded6 = |succeeded6 = |office7 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis |term_start7 = |term_end7 = |preceded7 = |succeeded7 = |office8 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] |term_start8 = |term_end8 = |preceded8 = |succeeded8 = |birth_name = |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] |party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} |spouse = |children = 1 Daughter and 2 sons |residence = |alma_mater = Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA |signature = |website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01}} He served as the [[People’s Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv}} He was elected as the [[People’s Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012}} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | dead-url=yes | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

{{Infobox Officeholder | name = Abdulla Shahid
