[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | Also Known As = Carpet Vagu }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}} He served as the [[People’s Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People’s Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == Morroco Carpet Theft == Foreign Minister Abdullah Shahid is was suspected to stole a carpet for allegedly accepting a gift from the Moroccan Prime Minister Dr.Saadeddine Othman in the end of 2019. the media official of Anti Corruption Comission of Maldives revealed that it had accepted a case whereby it is alleged that Minister Shahid had received a carpet from the Moroccan Prime Minister, which he took to his own home. According to law, it is mandatory that gifts received by officials during their official trips abroad is handed over to the state. While Minister Shahid is facing scrutiny over the allegation, Foreign Ministry of Maldives has denied any wrongdoing by the Minister. The Communications Director of the ministry, Miuvan Mohamed said that the carpet is at the Ministry, and that the Minister did not take it to home. “He didn't take it home, it was always at the Ministry. Ministry follows established laws and protocol on such issues”, said Miuvan. {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start2 = 28 May 2008 | term_end2 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor2 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor2 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office3 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy3 = | term_start3 = 28 May 2014 | term_end3 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor3 = | successor3 = | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start4 = 28 May 2008 | term_end4 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | term_start5 = | term_end5 = | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | term_start6 = | term_end6 = | preceded6 = | succeeded6 = | office7 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | term_start7 = | term_end7 = | preceded7 = | succeeded7 = | office8 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | term_start8 = | term_end8 = | preceded8 = | succeeded8 = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | spouse = | children = 1 Daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}} He served as the [[People’s Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People’s Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. == Morroco Carpet Theft == Foreign Minister Abdullah Shahid was suspected to stole a carpet for allegedly accepting a gift from the Moroccan Prime Minister Dr.Saadeddine Othman in the end of 2019. the media official of Anti Corruption Comission of Maldives revealed that it had accepted a case whereby it is alleged that Minister Shahid had received a carpet from the Moroccan Prime Minister, which he took to his own home. According to law, it is mandatory that gifts received by officials during their official trips abroad is handed over to the state. While Minister Shahid is facing scrutiny over the allegation, Foreign Ministry of Maldives has denied any wrongdoing by the Minister. The Communications Director of the ministry, Miuvan Mohamed said that the carpet is at the Ministry, and that the Minister did not take it to home. “He didn't take it home, it was always at the Ministry. Ministry follows established laws and protocol on such issues”, said Miuvan. {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}} He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start2 = 28 May 2008 | term_end2 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor2 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor2 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office3 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy3 = | term_start3 = 28 May 2014 | term_end3 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor3 = | successor3 = | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start4 = 28 May 2008 | term_end4 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | term_start5 = | term_end5 = | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | term_start6 = | term_end6 = | preceded6 = | succeeded6 = | office7 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | term_start7 = | term_end7 = | preceded7 = | succeeded7 = | office8 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | term_start8 = | term_end8 = | preceded8 = | succeeded8 = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | spouse = | children = 1 Daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}} He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}} He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election and the President of the 76th [[United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}} He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. On 07 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the President of the 76th [[United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. On 07 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the President of the 76th [[United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]]

[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start2 = 28 May 2008 | term_end2 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor2 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor2 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office3 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy3 = | term_start3 = 28 May 2014 | term_end3 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor3 = | successor3 = | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start4 = 28 May 2008 | term_end4 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | term_start5 = | term_end5 = | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | term_start6 = | term_end6 = | preceded6 = | succeeded6 = | office7 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | term_start7 = | term_end7 = | preceded7 = | succeeded7 = | office8 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | term_start8 = | term_end8 = | preceded8 = | succeeded8 = | birth_name = | birth_date = 26 May 1962 | birth_place = Malé, Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 Daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = Canberra College of Advanced Education, Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election and the President of the 76th [[United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}} He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker_of_the_People's_Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008. {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984,eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004-Aug 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid,MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} Shahid holds a bachelor's degree in Social Science (Politics) from the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], and a master's degree in International Relations from [[the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]] at [[Tufts University]]. On 07 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the President of the 76th [[United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:People from Malé]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election and the 76th [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} ==Biography== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000 he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008 in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013 he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}} {{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} On 7 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the 76th [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]]

އަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު | image = Abdulla Shahid (32217203517) (cropped).jpg | order = | office = [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th UN General Assembly]] | predecessor = [[Volkan Bozkır]] | term_start = September 2021 | office1 = Minister of Foreign Affairs | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election and the 76th [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} ==Biography== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000, he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} On 7 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the 76th [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]]

އަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު | image = Abdulla Shahid (32217203517) (cropped).jpg | order = | office1 = Minister of Foreign Affairs | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election and the 76th [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000, he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===As UNGA president=== On 7 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the 76th President of the United Nations General Assembly with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]]

{{short description|Maldivian politician}} {{Infobox Officeholder | name = Abdulla Shahid
އަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު | image = Abdulla Shahid April 2021.png | caption = Shahid in 2021 | order = | office1 = Minister of Foreign Affairs | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election and the 76th [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000, he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===As UNGA president=== On 7 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]]

[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election and the 76th [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000, he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===As UNGA president=== On 7 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]]
