[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is the current Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives as of the 2018 election and the 76th [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President–elect of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to become the President of the General Assembly. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000, he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===As UNGA president=== On 7 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=Taking office 2021}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===As UNGA president=== On 7 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=Taking office 2021}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

{{short description|Maldivian politician and current President of the UN 76th General Assembly}} {{Infobox Officeholder | name = Abdulla Shahid
އަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު | image = Abdulla Shahid April 2021.png | caption = Shahid in 2021 | order = | office = [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th UN General Assembly]] | status = | term_start = 14 September 2021 | term_end = | succeeding = | predecessor = [[Volkan Bozkır]] | successor = | office1 = Minister of Foreign Affairs | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who has served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives since 2018. He is the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President–elect of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to become the President of the General Assembly. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000, he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===As UNGA president=== On 7 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=Taking office 2021}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===As UNGA president=== On 7 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=Taking office 2021}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

{{short description|Maldivian politician and current President of the UN 76th General Assembly}} {{Infobox Officeholder | name = Abdulla Shahid
އަބްދު ޝާހިދު | image = Abdulla Shahid April 2021.png | caption = Shahid in 2021 | order = | office = [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th UN General Assembly]] | status = | term_start = 14 September 2021 | term_end = | succeeding = | predecessor = [[Volkan Bozkır]] | successor = | office1 = Minister of Foreign Affairs | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who has served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives since 2018. He is the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to become the President of the General Assembly. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== He served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru. [[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|left|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. on February 20, 2019.]] Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference. In 2000, he was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency. Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005. On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===As UNGA president=== On 7 June 2021, Abdulla was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming three-fourth majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against and no abstentions and no invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=Taking office 2021}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Abdulla Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference.{{fact}} In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{fact}} Shahid previously served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{fact}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===As UNGA president=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=Taking office 2021}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference.{{fact}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{fact}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{fact}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=Taking office 2021}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

{{short description|Maldivian politician and current President of the UN 76th General Assembly}} {{Infobox Officeholder | name = Abdulla Shahid
އަބްދު ޝާހިދު | image = Abdulla Shahid April 2021.png | caption = Shahid in 2021 | order = | office = [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th UN General Assembly]] | status = | term_start = 14 September 2021 | term_end = | succeeding = | predecessor = [[Volkan Bozkır]] | successor = | office1 = Minister of Foreign Affairs | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who has served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives since 2018. He is the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to become the President of the General Assembly. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{fact|date=September 2021}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference.{{fact|date=September 2021}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{fact|date=September 2021}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{fact|date=September 2021}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=Taking office 2021}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=Taking office 2021}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who has served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Maldives since 2018. He is the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to become the President of the General Assembly. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid was tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The {{Short description|Maldivian politician and current President of the UN 76th General Assembly}} {{Infobox officeholder |honorific_prefix = [[Excellency|His Excellency]] | name = Abdulla Shahid
އަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު | image = Abdulla Shahid April 2021.png | caption = Shahid in 2021 | order = | office = [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th UN General Assembly]] | status = | term_start = 14 September 2021 | term_end = | succeeding = | predecessor = [[Volkan Bozkır]] | successor = | office1 = Minister of Foreign Affairs | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Henveiru Uthuru (Kaafu Atoll)|Henveiru Uthuru]] constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]] for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = Vaavu Atoll Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], Maldives | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 1 daughter and 2 sons | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = Maldives }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician who has served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs for Maldives since 2018. He is the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]].{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to become the President of the General Assembly. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the Speaker of the People’s Majlis on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People’s Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the Commonwealth, Non-Aligned Movement and the Organization of Islamic Conference.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the Special Majlis (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new Constitution of the Maldives. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{citation needed|date=September 2021}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid was tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}}
