''{{small|as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]}}''|years=when not in session}} {{s-aft|after=[[Hersey Kyota]]|as=[[List of ambassadors to the United States|Ambassador to the United States]] for [[Palau]]}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

revision.comment: Changing [[Wikipedia:Short description|short description]] from "Maldivian politician and current President of the UN 76th General Assembly" to "Maldivian politician and President of the UN 76th General Assembly"
revision.text:
{{Short description|Maldivian politician and President of the UN 76th General Assembly}} {{Infobox officeholder |honorific_prefix = [[Excellency|His Excellency]] | name = Abdulla Shahid | native_name = {{nobold|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}} | image = Abdulla Shahid April 2021.png | caption = Shahid in 2021 | order = | office = [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th UN General Assembly]] | status = | term_start = 14 September 2021 | term_end = 13 September 2022 | predecessor = [[Volkan Bozkır]] | successor = [[Csaba Kőrösi]] | office1 = [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs]] | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]]
for Henveiru Uthuru constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]]
for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = [[Vaavu Atoll]] Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Sultanate of the Maldives]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivian citizenship|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 3 | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = [[Maldives]] }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is Maldivian politician who served as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th United Nations General Assembly]] between 2021 and 2022.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to hold that post. He has been serving as [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs, Maldives]] since 2018. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People's Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{Cite web|title=18th Parliament Members|url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/18-parliament/members/76|publisher=[[Government of the Maldives]]|date=2018}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director in 1993. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], the [[Non-Aligned Movement]] and the [[Organization of Islamic Conference]].{{Cite web|title=PGA Biography|url=https://www.un.org/pga/76/about/biography/|publisher=[[United Nations]]|date=2020}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the [[Special Majlis]] (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new [[Constitution of the Maldives]]. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{Cite web|title=Foreign ministry profiles|url=https://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?maldives|publisher=Berlin Global}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{Cite web|title=Minister of Foreign Affairs|url=https://www.gov.mv/en/people/abdulla-shahid|publisher=Government of the Maldives}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]
''{{small|as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]}}''|years=when in session}} {{s-aft|after=[[António Guterres]]|as=[[Secretary-General of the United Nations]]}} {{s-bef|before=[[António Guterres]]|as=[[Secretary-General of the United Nations]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]
''{{small|as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]}}''|years=when not in session}} {{s-aft|after=[[Hersey Kyota]]|as=[[List of ambassadors to the United States|Ambassador to the United States]] for [[Palau]]}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician and President of the UN 76th General Assembly}} {{Infobox officeholder |honorific_prefix = [[Excellency|His Excellency]] | name = Abdulla Shahid | native_name = {{nobold|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}} | image = Abdulla Shahid April 2021.png | caption = Shahid in 2021 | order = | office = [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th UN General Assembly]] | status = | term_start = 14 September 2021 | term_end = 13 September 2022 | predecessor = [[Volkan Bozkır]] | successor = [[Csaba Kőrösi]] | office1 = [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs]] | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = [[Maldives]] }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is Maldivian politician who served as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th United Nations General Assembly]] between 2021 and 2022.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to hold that post. He has been serving as [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs, Maldives]] since 2018. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People's Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{Cite web|title=18th Parliament Members|url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/18-parliament/members/76|publisher=[[Government of the Maldives]]|date=2018}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director in 1993. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], the [[Non-Aligned Movement]] and the [[Organization of Islamic Conference]].{{Cite web|title=PGA Biography|url=https://www.un.org/pga/76/about/biography/|publisher=[[United Nations]]|date=2020}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the [[Special Majlis]] (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new [[Constitution of the Maldives]]. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{Cite web|title=Foreign ministry profiles|url=https://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?maldives|publisher=Berlin Global}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{Cite web|title=Minister of Foreign Affairs|url=https://www.gov.mv/en/people/abdulla-shahid|publisher=Government of the Maldives}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician and President of the UN 76th General Assembly}} {{Infobox officeholder |honorific_prefix = [[Excellency|His Excellency]] | name = Abdulla Shahid | native_name = {{nobold|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}} | image = Abdulla Shahid April 2021.png | caption = Shahid in 2021 | order = | office = [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th UN General Assembly]] | status = | term_start = 14 September 2021 | term_end = 13 September 2022 | predecessor = [[Volkan Bozkır]] | successor = [[Csaba Kőrösi]] | office1 = [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs]] | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]]
for Henveiru Uthuru constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]]
for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = [[Vaavu Atoll]] Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Sultanate of the Maldives]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivian citizenship|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }} | children = 3 | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = [[Maldives]] }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is a Maldivian politician who served as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th United Nations General Assembly]] between 2021 and 2022.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to hold that post. He has been serving as [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs, Maldives]] since 2018. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People's Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{Cite web|title=18th Parliament Members|url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/18-parliament/members/76|publisher=[[Government of the Maldives]]|date=2018}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director in 1993. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], the [[Non-Aligned Movement]] and the [[Organization of Islamic Conference]].{{Cite web|title=PGA Biography|url=https://www.un.org/pga/76/about/biography/|publisher=[[United Nations]]|date=2020}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the [[Special Majlis]] (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new [[Constitution of the Maldives]]. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{Cite web|title=Foreign ministry profiles|url=https://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?maldives|publisher=Berlin Global}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{Cite web|title=Minister of Foreign Affairs|url=https://www.gov.mv/en/people/abdulla-shahid|publisher=Government of the Maldives}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]

He has been serving as [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs, Maldives]] since 2018. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People's Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{Cite web|title=18th Parliament Members|url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/18-parliament/members/76|publisher=[[Government of the Maldives]]|date=2018}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director in 1993. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], the [[Non-Aligned Movement]] and the [[Organization of Islamic Conference]].{{Cite web|title=PGA Biography|url=https://www.un.org/pga/76/about/biography/|publisher=[[United Nations]]|date=2020}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the [[Special Majlis]] (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new [[Constitution of the Maldives]]. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{Cite web|title=Foreign ministry profiles|url=https://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?maldives|publisher=Berlin Global}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{Cite web|title=Minister of Foreign Affairs|url=https://www.gov.mv/en/people/abdulla-shahid|publisher=Government of the Maldives}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = [[Maldives]] | otherparty = [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]] (before 2013) }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is a Maldivian politician who served as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th United Nations General Assembly]] between 2021 and 2022.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to hold that post. He has been serving as [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs, Maldives]] since 2018. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People's Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{Cite web|title=18th Parliament Members|url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/18-parliament/members/76|publisher=[[Government of the Maldives]]|date=2018}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director in 1993. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], the [[Non-Aligned Movement]] and the [[Organization of Islamic Conference]].{{Cite web|title=PGA Biography|url=https://www.un.org/pga/76/about/biography/|publisher=[[United Nations]]|date=2020}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the [[Special Majlis]] (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new [[Constitution of the Maldives]]. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{Cite web|title=Foreign ministry profiles|url=https://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?maldives|publisher=Berlin Global}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{Cite web|title=Minister of Foreign Affairs|url=https://www.gov.mv/en/people/abdulla-shahid|publisher=Government of the Maldives}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{commons category}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]

''{{small|as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]}}''|years=when not in session}} {{s-aft|after=[[Hersey Kyota]]|as=[[List of ambassadors to the United States|Ambassador to the United States]] for [[Palau]]}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:The Fletcher School at Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

He has been serving as [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs, Maldives]] since 2018. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People's Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{Cite web|title=18th Parliament Members|url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/18-parliament/members/76|publisher=[[Government of the Maldives]]|date=2018}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director in 1993. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], the [[Non-Aligned Movement]] and the [[Organization of Islamic Conference]].{{Cite web|title=PGA Biography|url=https://www.un.org/pga/76/about/biography/|publisher=[[United Nations]]|date=2020}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the [[Special Majlis]] (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new [[Constitution of the Maldives]]. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{Cite web|title=Foreign ministry profiles|url=https://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?maldives|publisher=Berlin Global}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{Cite web|title=Minister of Foreign Affairs|url=https://www.gov.mv/en/people/abdulla-shahid|publisher=Government of the Maldives}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed for MDP.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{commons category}} {{wikiquote}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]

He has been serving as [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs, Maldives]] since 2018. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People's Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{Cite web|title=18th Parliament Members|url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/18-parliament/members/76|publisher=[[Government of the Maldives]]|date=2018}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director in 1993. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], the [[Non-Aligned Movement]] and the [[Organization of Islamic Conference]].{{Cite web|title=PGA Biography|url=https://www.un.org/pga/76/about/biography/|publisher=[[United Nations]]|date=2020}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the [[Special Majlis]] (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new [[Constitution of the Maldives]]. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{Cite web|title=Foreign ministry profiles|url=https://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?maldives|publisher=Berlin Global}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{Cite web|title=Minister of Foreign Affairs|url=https://www.gov.mv/en/people/abdulla-shahid|publisher=Government of the Maldives}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed up for [[Maldivian Democratic Party]].{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{commons category}} {{wikiquote}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]
''{{small|as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]}}''|years=when in session}} {{s-aft|after=[[António Guterres]]|as=[[Secretary-General of the United Nations]]}} {{s-bef|before=[[António Guterres]]|as=[[Secretary-General of the United Nations]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]
''{{small|as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]}}''|years=when not in session}} {{s-aft|after=[[Hersey Kyota]]|as=[[List of ambassadors to the United States|Ambassador to the United States]] for [[Palau]]}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:The Fletcher School at Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = [[Maldives]] | otherparty = [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]] (before 2013) }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is a Maldivian politician who served as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th United Nations General Assembly]] between 2021 and 2022.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to hold that post. He has been serving as [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs, Maldives]] since 2018. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People's Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{Cite web|title=18th Parliament Members|url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/18-parliament/members/76|publisher=[[Government of the Maldives]]|date=2018}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director in 1993. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], the [[Non-Aligned Movement]] and the [[Organization of Islamic Conference]].{{Cite web|title=PGA Biography|url=https://www.un.org/pga/76/about/biography/|publisher=[[United Nations]]|date=2020}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the [[Special Majlis]] (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new [[Constitution of the Maldives]]. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{Cite web|title=Foreign ministry profiles|url=https://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?maldives|publisher=Berlin Global}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{Cite web|title=Minister of Foreign Affairs|url=https://www.gov.mv/en/people/abdulla-shahid|publisher=Government of the Maldives}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed up for [[Maldivian Democratic Party]].{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{commons category}} {{wikiquote}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]

In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], the [[Non-Aligned Movement]] and the [[Organization of Islamic Conference]].{{Cite web|title=PGA Biography|url=https://www.un.org/pga/76/about/biography/|publisher=[[United Nations]]|date=2020}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the [[Special Majlis]] (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new [[Constitution of the Maldives]]. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{Cite web|title=Foreign ministry profiles|url=https://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?maldives|publisher=Berlin Global}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{Cite web|title=Minister of Foreign Affairs|url=https://www.gov.mv/en/people/abdulla-shahid|publisher=Government of the Maldives}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed up for [[Maldivian Democratic Party]].{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{commons category}} {{wikiquote}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]

''{{small|as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]}}''|years=when not in session}} {{s-aft|after=[[Hersey Kyota]]|as=[[List of ambassadors to the United States|Ambassador to the United States]] for [[Palau]]}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the UN General Assembly}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shahid, Abdulla}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party politicians]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian Muslims]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Presidents of the United Nations General Assembly]] [[Category:Speakers of the People's Majlis]] [[Category:The Fletcher School at Tufts University alumni]] [[Category:University of Canberra alumni]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician and President of the UN 76th General Assembly}} {{Infobox officeholder | honorific_prefix = [[Excellency|His Excellency]] | name = Abdulla Shahid | native_name = {{nobold|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}} | image = Abdulla Shahid April 2021.png | caption = Shahid in 2021 | order = | office = [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th UN General Assembly]] | status = | term_start = 14 September 2021 | term_end = 13 September 2022 | predecessor = [[Volkan Bozkır]] | successor = [[Csaba Kőrösi]] | office1 = [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs]] | president1 = [[Ibrahim Mohamed Solih]] | term_start1 = 17 November 2018 | term_end1 = 17 November 2023 | predecessor1 = [[Mohamed Asim]] | successor1 = [[Moosa Zameer]] | president2 = [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]] | term_start2 = 23 August 2007 | term_end2 = 11 November 2008 | predecessor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | successor2 = [[Ahmed Shaheed]] | office3 = 16th [[People's Majlis|Speaker of the People's Majlis]]{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} | president3 = [[Mohamed Nasheed]]
[[Mohammed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | term_start3 = 28 May 2008 | term_end3 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor3 = [[Mohamed Shihab]] | successor3 = [[Abdulla Maseeh Mohamed]] | office4 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]]
for Henveiru Uthuru constituency | deputy4 = | term_start4 = 28 May 2014 | term_end4 = 14 November 2018 | predecessor4 = | successor4 = | office5 = Member of [[People’s Majlis|Parliament]]
for [[Keyodhoo (Vaavu Atoll)|Keyodhoo]] constituency | term_start5 = 28 May 2008 | term_end5 = 28 May 2014 | predecessor5 = | successor5 = | office6 = President’s Member to the Special Majlis | office7 = President’s Member to the [[People’s Majlis]] | office8 = [[Vaavu Atoll]] Member to the Special Majlis | office9 = Executive Secretary to the [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom|President]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|5|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Sultanate of the Maldives]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Maldivian citizenship|Maldivian]] | party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]]{{cite news | url=http://sun.mv/english/11661 | title=Speaker Shahid joins MDP | work=Sun Online | date=April 18, 2013 | accessdate=April 18, 2013 | archive-date=May 21, 2013 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130521144905/http://sun.mv/english/11661 | url-status=dead }}{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |title=Speaker Shahid ends speculation, announces MDP switch |work=Haveeru Online |date=April 18, 2013 |accessdate=April 18, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421093352/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/news/48535 |archivedate=April 21, 2013 }}(2013-present) | children = 3 | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]], Australia
[[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], USA | signature = | website = | country = [[Maldives]] | otherparty = [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]] (before 2013) }} '''Abdulla Shahid''' ({{lang-dv|ޢަބްދުﷲ ޝާހިދު}}; born 26 May 1962) is a Maldivian politician who served as [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|President of the 76th United Nations General Assembly]] between 2021 and 2022.{{Cite web|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|title=The President's Office|website=presidency.gov.mv|access-date=2019-01-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190102050607/https://presidency.gov.mv/theCabinet|archive-date=2019-01-02|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/pga/75/wp-content/uploads/sites/100/2021/04/FM-Shahid-Bio-Note-Final-1.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid |website=un.org }} Shahid is the first Maldivian politician to hold that post. He had served as [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Maldives)|Minister of Foreign Affairs, Maldives]] from 2018 to 2023. ==Early life and education== Shahid joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1984, then he had his bachelor's degree in political science at the [[University of Canberra|Canberra College of Advanced Education]] in 1987. In 1990, he was a member of the advisory board of President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]] until 1994. In the meantime, he took a master's degree in international relations from the [[Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy]], [[Tufts University]] in 1991.{{cite web |url=http://archive.ipu.org/cnl-e/195/shahid.pdf |title=Honourable Abdulla Shahid, MP and Former Speaker Parliament of the Maldives |website=ipu.org |page=1 |date=16 November 2014 }} ==Career== Shahid served as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] of the [[Maldives]] from 2009 to 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|title=Kuryge raeesun|date=6 January 2019|publisher=Majlis|language=dv|access-date=6 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190106204240/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/di/kuryge_raeesun|archive-date=6 January 2019|url-status=dead}} He was elected as the [[People's Majlis#Speaker of the People's Majlis|Speaker of the People’s Majlis]] on 28 May 2009, the seventeenth holder of the position.{{cite web | url=http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | title=The Honorable Abdulla Shahid, MP, the Speaker of People's Majlis | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809135307/http://www.majlis.gov.mv/en/speaker-of-the-majlis/ | archive-date=August 9, 2016 | url-status=dead }} He won 42 votes out of 75 votes. Shahid played a key role in the Maldives’ transition to democracy in 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |title=Opposition members elected to position of Majlis Speaker, Deputy Speaker |work=Haveeru Daily |date=May 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 28, 2012 |location=Maldives |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303233044/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/english/details/26459 |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }} Abdulla Shahid is a member of [[Maldivian Democratic Party|MDP]] and is the parliament member for Henveiru Uthuru.{{Cite web|title=18th Parliament Members|url=https://majlis.gov.mv/en/18-parliament/members/76|publisher=[[Government of the Maldives]]|date=2018}} {{stack|[[File:Secretary Pompeo Meets With Maldives Foreign Minister Shahid in Washington (32217203517).jpg|thumb|Shahid meets with [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Mike Pompeo|Michael R. Pompeo]] at the [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] in Washington, D.C. (20 February 2019).]]}} Prior to his role as an MP, Shahid served in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs from 1984, eventually becoming Director in 1993. In this capacity, he also headed the International Organizations and Conferences Department, representing the Maldives at meetings and international gatherings including the United Nations, the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], the [[Non-Aligned Movement]] and the [[Organization of Islamic Conference]].{{Cite web|title=PGA Biography|url=https://www.un.org/pga/76/about/biography/|publisher=[[United Nations]]|date=2020}} ===Member of Parliament=== In 2000, Shahid was elected as the Representative of the Vaavu Atoll constituency and served two terms as the Atoll’s Member. Shahid served in the [[Special Majlis]] (July 2004 – August 2008) which drafted the new [[Constitution of the Maldives]]. In May 2009, in the first multi-party parliamentary elections of the Maldives, Shahid won the Keyodhoo Constituency.{{Cite web|title=Foreign ministry profiles|url=https://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?maldives|publisher=Berlin Global}} ===Minister of Foreign Affairs=== Shahid served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 23 August 2007 to 11 November 2008, in the presidency of Maumoon Abdul Gayoom. He had been appointed Minister of State for Foreign Affairs in 2005.{{Cite web|title=Minister of Foreign Affairs|url=https://www.gov.mv/en/people/abdulla-shahid|publisher=Government of the Maldives}} On 15 April 2013, Shahid resigned from the [[Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party]]. On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed up for [[Maldivian Democratic Party]].{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{commons category}} {{wikiquote}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]

On 18 April 2013, he announced on Twitter that he had signed up for [[Maldivian Democratic Party]].{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/abdulla_shahid/statuses/324762978698293248 |title=Twitter/ @abdulla_shahid |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=April 18, 2013}}{{cite web | url=http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | title=His Excellency Mr. Abdulla Shahid, MP ''A Biographical Note'' | publisher=Foreign Ministry of Maldives | accessdate=September 28, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811101117/http://foreign.gov.mv/new/tpl/show/content/ashahid | archive-date=August 11, 2014 | url-status=dead | df=mdy-all }} ===UN General Assembly President=== On 7 June 2021, Shahid was elected as the [[President of the United Nations General Assembly|76th President of the United Nations General Assembly]] with an overwhelming 75 percent majority, with 143 in favour, 48 against, and no abstentions or invalid votes.{{cite web |url=https://edition.mv/sports/22659 |title=Maldives' FM Abdulla Shahid elected as President of UN General Assembly |website=edition.mv |date=7 June 2021 }} On 23 December 2021 Shahid tested positive for COVID-19.{{Cite news|others=PTI|date=2021-12-23|title=UN General Assembly President Abdulla Shahid tests positive for COVID-19|language=en-IN|work=The Hindu|url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/un-general-assembly-president-abdulla-shahid-tests-positive-for-covid-19/article38020686.ece|access-date=2021-12-27|issn=0971-751X}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{commons category}} {{wikiquote}} {{s-start}} {{s-dip}} {{s-bef|before=[[Volkan Bozkır]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the United Nations General Assembly]]|years=2021–2022}} {{s-aft|after=[[Csaba Kőrösi]]}} {{s-break}} {{s-prec|usa}} {{s-bef|before=[[Antony Blinken]]|as=[[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[United States order of precedence|Order of precedence of the United States]]
